bill.title: QUEST Contracting
bill.description: Establishes limits on requests for proposals from health and human services providers for QUEST contracts that exceed $100,000,000 and commence after the term of the agency director expires. Effective upon approval. (SD2)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to HLT/HUS, FIN, referral sheet 2
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT/HUS on Tuesday, 02-02-10 10:30 AM in House conference room 329.

(H) The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Yamane, Nishimoto, Bertram, Brower, Mizuno, Shimabukuro; Ayes with reservations: Finnegan; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Belatti, Carroll.

(H) The committees on HUS recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Mizuno, Brower, Bertram, Nishimoto, Shimabukuro, Yamane; Ayes with reservations: Ward; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Belatti, Carroll.
(H) Reported from HLT/HUS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 284-10), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Monday, 02-22-10 10:00AM in House conference room 308.
(H) Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) M. Oshiro, M. Lee, Aquino, Awana, Brower, Choy, Coffman, Har, C. Lee, Nishimoto, Sagum, Tokioka, Wooley, Yamashita; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Finnegan; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Keith-Agaran, Ward.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 599-10) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-02-10.
(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 1 with none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 180).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to HMS/HTH, JGO.
(S) The committee(s) on HMS/HTH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-16-10 3:00PM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on HMS recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in HMS were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Chun Oakland, Ihara, Green; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Hemmings.

(S) The committee(s) on HTH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in HTH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Ige, Green, Baker, Espero, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Hemmings.
(S) Reported from HMS/HTH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2791) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JGO.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JGO.
(S) The committee(s) on JGO will hold a public decision making on 03-30-10 10:00AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JGO recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JGO were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Taniguchi, Takamine, Gabbard, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 2 No(es): Senator(s) Bunda, Slom; and 0 Excused: none.
(S) Reported from JGO (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2985) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 04-06-10.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 2 (Senator(s) Hemmings, Slom). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 424) in amended form (SD 2).
(H) House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
(S) Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 462).
(S) Senate Conferees appointed: Chun Oakland, Chair; Ige, Taniguchi, Co-Chair(s); .

(H) House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
(H) Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 2 with Representative(s) Ching, Finnegan, Marumoto, Pine voting no (4) and Representative(s) Har, Herkes, Souki excused (3).

(H) Vetoed on 04-25-10 (Gov. Msg. No. 281).
(S) Vetoed on 04-25-10 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 529).
(H) Veto overridden by 2/3's vote with 45 Ayes; 6 Noes Representative(s) Ching, Finnegan, Marumoto, Pine, Thielen, Ward; and 0 Excused none.
(S) Veto overridden - 2/3's vote: Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 2 (Senator(s) Hemmings, Slom). Excused, 0 (none).
(H) Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 666) motion to override veto that was approved and carried by a 2/3 vote by the members of the Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 636) motion to override veto that was approved and carried by a 2/3 vote by the members of the House.
(H) Act 71, on 4/29/2010, veto override.
